2.text: Spray a baking dish with non-stick spray.

3.text: Place the haddock in the baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

4.text: Melt the butter in a bowl and add the lemon juice and garlic.

5.text: Brush the mixture evenly over the haddock.

6.text: Sprinkle the parsley, tarragon, and paprika over the fish.

7.text: Bake the haddock for 25 minutes until it’s flaky.

8.text: Pat the haddock dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

9.text: Heat the olive oil in a skillet on medium-high heat.

10.text: Place the haddock in the pan with the seasoned side down.

11.text: Season the other side with salt and pepper and let it cook for 2-3 minutes.

12.text: Flip the haddock and let it cook for another 2-3 minutes.

13.text: Remove the fish from the skillet and serve it hot.

14.text: Place the top oven rack 6 inches (15 cm) and turn on the broiler.

15.text: Arrange the haddock filets on a greased broiler pan.

16.text: Mix the seasonings and sprinkle them over the haddock.

17.text: Put the pieces of butter on the haddock filets.

18.text: Broil the haddock for 6-8 minutes then serve it with a lemon garnish.

19.text: Heat canola oil in a cast-iron pan over high heat.

20.text: Combine the cornmeal, paprika, and pepper in a bowl.

21.text: Fill another bowl with the milk and buttermilk.

22.text: Dredge the haddock in the milk and cornmeal mixtures.

23.text: Fry the haddock in the skillet for 2 minutes on each side.

24.text: Place the fish on a bun with tartar sauce, coleslaw, and pickles.
